Please write to me every mail.  In the last mail I sent a response to your question regarding your coming to America.  I dare not take the responsibility of deciding this matter.  You can do as you think best, and as your friends shall decide.  I dare not at my age take any more responsibility.  I have very heavy burdens to bear in connection with the cause of God.  Morning after morning I rise at one and two o'clock, to write out 
                                                                           62
important matters.  -- Letter 41, 1905. (To Brother and Sister Stephen Belden).
